item.title: Annie add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "Our heads are round so thought can change direction" -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Annie add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I’m an egotist, but I’m not selfish. There’s a difference. I’m a neurotic, I guess. I can’t stop thinking about myself. It isn’t that I think myself so important... I simply can’t think about anything else, that’s all. If I could fall in love with a woman that might help some. But I can’t find a woman who interests me." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Annie add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I've lived out my melancholy youth. I don't give a fuck anymore what's behind me, or what's ahead of me. I'm healthy. Incurably healthy. No sorrows, no regrets. No past, no future. The present is enough for me. Day by day. Today!" -- Henry Miller

item.title: Annie add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The real leader has no need to lead. He is content to point the way." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Annie add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everyday we slaughter our finest impulses. That is why we get a heartache when we read the lines written by the hand of a master and recognize them as our own, as the tender shoots which we stifled because we lacked the faith to believe in our own powers, our own criterion of truth and beauty. Everyman, when he gets quiet, when he becomes desperately honest with himself, is capable of uttering profound truths." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I hate how I don't feel real enough unless people are watching." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's pathetic how we can't live with the things we can't understand. How we need everything labeled and explained and deconstructed." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "May I never be complete. May I never be content. May I never be perfect." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Almost all the time, you tell yourself you're loving somebody when you're just using them. This only looks like love." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Everything is funnier in retrospect, funnier and prettier and cooler. You can laugh at anything from far enough away." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "We've spent so much time judging what other people created that we've created very, very little of our own." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "A motion picture, or music, or television, they have to maintain a certain decorum in order to be broadcast to a vast audience. Other forms of mass media cost too much to produce a risk reaching only a limited audience. Only one person. But a book. . . . A book is cheap to print and bind. A book is as private and consensual as sex. A book takes time and effort to consume - something that gives a reader every chance to walk away. Actually, so few people make the effort to read that it's difficult to call books a "mass medium." No one really gives a damn about books. No one has bothered to ban a book in decades." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "You have to keep recycling yourself." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The best way to waste your life, is by taking notes. The easiest way to avoid living is to just watch. Look for the details. Report. Don't participate." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "and i can't stand the idea of being alone. i can't bear the thought of being free." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Pretty much always. We need to tell the story of our life to someone." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I've never been lonely. I've been in a room -- I've felt suicidal. I've been depressed. I've felt awful -- awful beyond all -- but I never felt that one other person could enter that room and cure what was bothering me...or that any number of people could enter that room. In other words, loneliness is something I've never been bothered with because I've always had this terrible itch for solitude. It's being at a party, or at a stadium full of people cheering for something, that I might feel loneliness. I'll quote Ibsen, "The strongest men are the most alone." I've never thought, "Well, some beautiful blonde will come in here and give me a fuck-job, rub my balls, and I'll feel good." No, that won't help. You know the typical crowd, "Wow, it's Friday night, what are you going to do? Just sit there?" Well, yeah. Because there's nothing out there. It's stupidity. Stupid people mingling with stupid people. Let them stupidify themselves. I've never been bothered with the need to rush out into the night. I hid in bars, because I didn't want to hide in factories. That's all. Sorry for all the millions, but I've never been lonely. I like myself. I'm the best form of entertainment I have. Let's drink more wine!" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "The shortest distance between two points is often unbearable." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"unless it comes out of your soul like a rocket, unless being still would drive you to madness or suicide or murder, don't do it. unless the sun inside you is burning your gut, don't do it.
when it is truly time, and if you have been chosen, it will do it by itself and it will keep on doing it until you die or it dies in you.
there is no other way.
and there never was." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"great writers are indecent people they live unfairly saving the best part for paper.
good human beings save the world so that bastards like me can keep creating art, become immortal. if you read this after I am dead it means I made it." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Annie add a quote by Eugène Ionesco
item.description: "That's how we stay young these days: murder and suicide." -- Eugène Ionesco

item.title: Annie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "If we believe in nothing, if nothing has any meaning and if we can affirm no values whatsoever, then everything is possible and nothing has any importance." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Annie add a quote by Nietzsche, Friedrich
item.description: "As long as you still experience the stars as something "above you", you lack the eye of knowledge." -- Nietzsche, Friedrich

item.title: Annie add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "The key to good decision making is not knowledge. It is understanding. We are swimming in the former. We are desperately lacking in the latter." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Annie add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "Once a musician has enough ability to get into a top music school, the thing that distinguishes one performer from another is how hard he or she works. That's it. And what's more, the people at the very top don't work just harder or even much harder than everyone else. They work much, much harder." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Annie add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "Truly successful decision-making relies on a balance between deliberate and instinctive thinking." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Annie add a quote by Cheryl Strayed
item.description: "Don't surrender all your joy for an idea you used to have about yourself that isn't true anymore." -- Cheryl Strayed
